intervention_catalogue.name: Stepwise Driving
intervention_catalogue.short_description: Stepwise Driving is designed to support desistance from drink driving by focusing on areas such as awareness of safe driving, making decisions and consequential thinking.
intervention_catalogue.long_description:
Stepwise Driving is designed to support desistance from drink driving by focusing on areas such as awareness of safe driving, making decisions and consequential thinking. 

This intervention includes insight-orientated, psychoeducational content around: 

* safer driving, for example, reaction times and stopping distances

* consequences of dangerous driving

* effects of alcohol and drugs on driving

* coping with disqualification
intervention_catalogue.session_detail: 1 x one-to-one session and 5 x group sessions

special_educational_needs.exclusion_literacy_level_guide: The person you are referring must be able to read and understand simple sentences.

exclusion.remaining_license_community_order_guide: If there are less than 9 months remaining on the licence or community order, you should check with the Treatment Manager.
exclusion.alcohol_drug_problem_guide: Any alcohol or drug-related problems must be stable before attending the programme
exclusion.mental_health_problem_guide: People with mental health problems should only be excluded from the programme if the issues are acute and damage their ability to relate to others or concentrate.
exclusion.not_allowed_if_eligible_for_another_inte: If the person meets the criteria for an Accredited Programme, or another Structured Intervention, they can do Stepwise Driving alongside it.
